name: Museum Suites

reviews.text: I have stayed in many hotels in Amsterdam. This is certainly one of the best. An excellent location near Vondelspark, excellent service, friendly staff, breakfasts in a magnificent dining room, home-like atmosphere -- what more would a traveler want?
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife and i stayed in the van gogh suite in august,the house its self stands out, well decorated to a very high standard in a quiet part of the city near the museums,the house and the rooms are spotless, fresh flowers and marble floors really nice, we have been comming to amsterdam for years and never came across anywhere as good, the breakfast was nice and was served in the lovely library,sabine and freda welcomed us on arrivial and took care of any needs/ questions we had, peace and quiet with a touch of luxury in amsterdam would sum up our experience of this great place,we will be back, peace.
reviews.title: perfect place amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our four nights in the Rembrandt room proved to be blissful and satisfying. We always felt like we were coming home when returning from our adventures in the city. The Suites is a four-room hotel where each of the four accommodations is decorated as per the style of a Dutch artist. The Rembrandt room was lush, with chandelier, fireplace, silk drapes and a roomy bathroom. Coffee was made available per the single-prep machine, tea from teabags. There's a small mini-fridge with drink options. Our beds were firm and warm. Wifi was fully available and fairly fast. The bathroom was well-appointed, with tub, overhead shower and hand-held shower. Soaps, plenty of towels and a hair dryer were immediately at hand.
reviews.title: Near Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only caution would be to those who are light sleepers. The Rembrandt room is above the street, Willemsparkweg, and our first night was somewhat noisy, even with windows closed and drapes drawn. However, this proved not to be an issue, as we had earplugs, and the following three nights, we slept very well, not even opting for the earplugs.
reviews.title: Central, luxury B&B - delightful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Museum Suites staff is efficient, thoughtful and informative. Frieda and Sabine helped us with a couple of scheduling chores, and the breakfast they serve (extra fee) is filling and satisfying. Rooms were kept spotless. And I mean, spotless.
reviews.title: Home in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Veermer Suite for 5 nights in june an it exeeded all your expectations! The room was spotless and beautiful. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We can highly recommend this hotel. The location was also good with easy access to the city center and the tram stop just a few meter away.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
Lovely boutique hotel in Amsterdam
reviews.text: We stayed in the Van Gogh Suite for 3 nights in June, and were very impressed. The room was lovely and light with a big terrace overlooking the gardens and adjacent houses towards the back. The location is in a very nice quiet part of town, with some pretty cafes and boutiques within a short walk. It is also very convenient for the tram stop (very easy to use) if you want to head in to the more touristy areas, and just a few minutes walk to the Van Gogh museum. Although breakfast is not included in the price, Frieda or Annemarie can recommend a nearby cafe, or if you prefer there are grocery shops nearby where you can pick up fruit/yoghurt/pastries to bring back and take advantage of the nespresso machine in the room. We would not hesitate to stay here again. In terms of restaurant recommendations, we would definitely recommend De Kas for creative fine dining, Sama Sebo for great Indonesian and Toscanini for lively high quality Italian food - all require booking in advance!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I arrived in Amsterdam on a chilly wet morning in early June, but couldn't have have received a warmer, friendlier welcome from the owners of the Museum Suites. We chose this small hotel because we like the personal touch. We've stayed in many small inns and hotels around the world, but mother and daugher team Frieda and Annemarie have set a new standard in hospitality for us. Just one example...: I asked Annemarie to make dinner reservations for us at an Indonesian rice table restaurant recommended by a guide book. Annemarie called the restaurant several times, but couldn't get an answer. She didn't give up - she actually walked over to the restaurant (which was several blocks away) to see what was up. At this point, I should mention that Annemarie was heavily pregnant. Alas, as so often happens with guide book recommendations, the restaurant had closed. But all was not lost. Annemarie booked us into another Indonesian place called Blauw, and we had an excellent, memorable meal. We were more than satisfied with all aspects of our stay at the Museum Suites. The hotel is situated in an upscale, vibrant neighbourhood; it is indeed close to the museums and a lovely quiet park, and there are excellent restaurants and shops close by. Our room, the Rembrandt, was very spacious even by North American standards, tastefully decorated and immaculately clean. Can't say enough good things about this small hotel. Trust the reviews!
reviews.title: Exceptional Dutch hospitality

reviews.text: My husband and I planned a short break in Amsterdam and found a gem of a place to stay. Museum Suites far exceeded my expectations. The staff were so helpful in every way and went the extra mile to make us feel welcome.  The location of the hotel was wonderful - close to the main museums we wanted to visit and on a tram route when we wanted to go downtown. The hotel is in a lovely quiet neighborhood with many restaurants just a block or two away.  There were grocery stores so we could buy what we needed for our breakfast (the room had a small but well equipped kitchen which was perfect for our needs).
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel in the Museum District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was the Vermeer Suite, located on the top floor. I was concerned about getting our luggage up the 3 steep flights of stairs but Annemarie arranged for a taxi which met our flight and the driver took the luggage up for us.
reviews.title: Evening with Van Gogh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were extremely happy with our stay at the Museum Suites. The Van Gogh suite was spacious and the outside terrace was very relaxing with the views of the neighborhood gardens. It was easy to walk down the block and get on the tram which took us all over the city. I especially loved being able to make a cup of coffee using the Nepresso coffee maker in our room. The host even set up our airport transportation for 7:30 am and then made sure that the driver arrived on time and helped us with our luggage. We would definitely recommend Museum Suites for anyone visiting Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Great location and pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in on Sunday, June 03, 2012 we simply had a wonderful 4 night stay at Museum Suites. We booked the Mondriaan Suite, which is located on the 3rd floor of the building, at the very end of a quite typical steep dutch city-house's stair. We were rewarded by a stunning and bright room facing the garden between Willemsparkweg and Van Breestraat. The room impressed for cleanness, size, style, amenities provided and attention to details (such as artwork, furniture and books inspired to Mondriaan, the artist to whom the room is dedicated). Shortly: an extremely comfortable and very quiet room were we settled magnificently and slept wonderfully. You can get a feeling by looking at the photos attached to this review. The property is located in the elegant Amsterdam's Museum District, within walking distance to e.g. Van Gogh's Museum, Rijksmuseum and Concertgebouw music hall. Furthermore Willemsparkweg is on tram's nr. 2 line which connects you easily to the center of the town (Spui, Dam, Railway station). The district also features a nice variety of restaurants: among them we enjoyed in particular "Brasserie Kaizer", the chinese innovative "Chang-I" (both located near the Concertgebouw), as well as the stylish "Spring" which sits opposite to "Brasserie de Joffers" were we had our daily outdoor breakfasts). Frieda Manshande and her daughter Annemarie are charming hosts and assure their presence during the day running their business very smoothly. In their studio on the 1st floor they are available for informations, advice, booking, ticket pre-sale and specific needs.
reviews.title: Excellent experience, wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PS: Visits to museums (and churches) in Amsterdam tend to be expensive. We were glad, upon suggestion, to have bought an "I amsterdam" city card which comes in different timed-priced options (such as 24h, 48h and 72h), grants free, discount or priviledged, access to numerous attractions, museums, churches and includes a public transportation ticket valid for the same duration.
reviews.title: An experience, definitely something unique.

reviews.text: PS 2: When walking around Amsterdam pay attention to (stricly in the following order): bicycles, trams, taxis, cars as the latter tend to stop and yield while the formers won't...
reviews.title: Vacationing in Amsterdam, Holland.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Suites are definitely something unique, something that you will not find anywhere. We booked one of the top notch rooms incl. Whirlpool, which should rather be called whirlbath.
reviews.title: Really good but a few drawbacks...

reviews.text: We travelled in June, spending three nights here with our young daughter. The owners prepared the sofa to create a bed for her. Yes, they're steep stairs, but this is what you expect in Amsterdam annd the quality of the accommodation was great. The welcome was friendky - helping us plan our day. We were encouraged to use the Grand Cafe a couple of hundred metres away - well frequented by the local residents too (does any one here eat breakfast at home?!)
reviews.title: Lovely welcome

reviews.text: We stayed 7 nights in the very comfortable Vermeer suite all the way at the top of this beautiful B and B. A real find!! We were travelling with 2 other couples who occupied 2 other suites: the Mondrian and the Van Gogh. We all felt like we were "at home" and loved the great location, the calm street, the copious breakfast. Frieda and Sabine could not have been more friendly and welcoming and they were both extremely helpful in recommending activities and restaurants. The rooms are beautifully appointed, freshly renovated and impeccably clean.
reviews.title: A gem in the Amsterdam museum neighborhood!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast - optional- is served in the dining room and is quite gorgeous and plentiful. One can also run over to the corner brasserie for breakfast since it is not included in the price of the room.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay, intimate, well located, high quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely stay there again if and when we come back to Amsterdam! My husband and I highly recommend Museum Suites!
reviews.title: Museum Suites ... Exceptional in Every Way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Catherine M
reviews.title: Gorgeous Guest House

description: The Museum Suites boutique hotel offers luxury rooms in a nineteenth-century mansion boasting historic links with the Rijksmuseum. Because of this ‘museum connection’, each of the hotel’s four spacious suites been inspired by a different Dutch painter, giving them a unique character and style. Museum Suites is situated in the cultural heart of the city, on the edge of the historic centre, a stone’s throw away from the popular Vondel Park and within walking distance of Amsterdam’s most fashionable shopping streets and main cultural venues, such as the Concertgebouw and the large national museums (Stedelijk, Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum). By offering you elegance, comfort, privacy and personal attention we aim to make your stay with us a highly enjoyable experience
